data.title: Regent University
data.meta_description: Learn about the programs, student life and fiancial aid available in Regent University
data.text:
Regent University was founded with the specific purpose to prepare leaders who were not only successful in their industry but would also advance Christian beliefs in order to impact others. The university was founded in 1977 under the leadership of M.G. "Pat" Robertson and incorporated in Virginia Beach as Christian Broadcasting Network University.

In 1990, the school was renamed Regent University and the new name was in reference to someone who served in power when a sovereign is absent, indicating that the college was representing Christ, the Sovereign. There were 77 students in the first class at the university, all enrolled in what was then called the School of Communication & the Arts. Classes were held in leased space in Chesapeake, Virginia and the first students graduated in May 1980. That same year, the college moved to its current campus in Virginia Beach. A secondary campus opened in Alexandria in 1995 with a program designed for teachers in the Washington, DC area, but that facility was sold at a later date.

The university's Divine Mission continues today with more than 6,000 students enrolled in undergraduate and graduate degrees at the school's campus and online. The academic programs are rigorous, but rewarding and the school remains a premier educational institution dedicated to combining higher education with biblical learning.

Regent University Accreditation Details

Regent University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges. In addition, programs at Regent University are accredited by:

Council for Higher Education

American Bar Association

Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs

Commission on Accreditation of the American Psychological Association

Teacher Education Accreditation Council

Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs

Academy of Strategic and Entrepreneurial Leadership

Commission on Accrediting of the Association of Theological Schools in the United States and Canada

National Association of Schools and Public Affairs and Administration

Regent University Application Requirements

Undergraduate students who wish to apply to Regent University must complete an online application and sign the Community Life Form. Incoming freshman with no college credit must also provide an official transcript from any high school attended. If college credits have been earned, students must provide official college transcripts. If a student has been out of high school for less than five years, they must provide SAT/ACT scores. In addition, students must provide an essay of between 300 and 500 words. Graduate programs may have additional requirements based on the degree program the student wishes to complete.

Regent University Tuition and Financial Aid

Full-time tuition for undergraduate students at Regent University is $15,300 while graduate tuition ranges between $4,690 to $35,335 depending on the degree program. Online program tuition ranges from $200 per credit hour to $1,110 per credit hour depending on the degree program.

Financial aid is available at Regent University through federal, state, private and institutional funding. Federal funding includes Pell Grants, Stafford Loans, PLUS Loans and Bar Exam Loans. State funding includes Virginia Tuition Assistance Grants, Virginia Teaching Scholarship Grants, Virginia Community College Transfer Grants and Virginia College Scholarship Assistance Programs. Students who live outside of Virginia may want to contact their state for possible state assistance with college tuition. Students may also qualify for private grants, scholarships and loans as well. Regent also offers endowed scholarships, church matching grants and program specific school-based scholarships.

Regent University Online Degrees Available

Doctor of Philosophy in Counselor Education & Supervision

The Doctor of Philosophy in Counselor Education & Supervision at Regent University is designed for counselors who are currently licensed but want to take their career to the next level. The program has a prescribed progression of coursework as well as an internship and dissertation requirement. The program focuses on integrating counseling knowledge with biblical foundations and faith practices. Students must complete three one-week, on-campus residencies as well as instructional programs designed to develop maximum team-building identity.

The degree requires 66 credit hours and may be completed in as little as three years. All courses are offered online other than the on-campus residency requirement. The program offers dual emphases in training educators who wish to teach future counselors at colleges and universities as well as advancing clinical supervision skills. Students must have completed a 48-credit hour master's degree in counseling or related field.

Students who attend an on-campus or online School of Psychology & Counseling information session may have their $50 application fee waived. Students must provide a personal goals statement and a current resume. Students must also provide official transcripts from any college or university attended as well as GRE scores. The university also requires a writing sample and three recommendation letters. A 10-15 minute video of a counseling session is required and all applicants must submit to an interview with faculty, which is by invitation only.

Tuition for the doctorate program is $790 per credit hour and students are expected to take 66 credits in order to complete the program. This means that total tuition for the degree program is approximately $52,140, but students are eligible for Stafford Loans up to 20,500 per year and have the potential to be offered a merit-based Scholarship ranging from $1,000 â€“ $12,000.

Individuals who would like to take their career to the next level, or who are seeking a career change, may find the options available at Regent University one of the best ways to achieve those goals. Courses are available online and on-campus that provide students with higher education that is based in a strong Christian faith. The online programs are designed to meet the needs of working adults and professionals whose family, employment and social obligations are obstacles to continuing their education. For those with such obstacles, programs available at Regent University offer them the best option for achieving their higher education goals and seeking the career path they desire.
